intro: Nototriche transandina, commonly known as the Andean nototriche, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive bracts and often medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, showy flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Nototriche transandina is adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil.
